cvars.AddChangeCallback.description:
CVARS [Shared/Menu] Adds a callback to be called when the named convar changes.

[string] name
  The name of the convar to add the change callback to.

[function] callback
  The function to be called when the convar changes. The arguments passed are:

 string convar - The name of the convar.
 string oldValue - The old value of the convar.
 string newValue - The new value of the convar.

[string] identifier=nil
  If set, you will be able to remove the callback using cvars.RemoveChangeCallback.

cvars.Bool.description:
CVARS [Shared/Menu] Retrieves console variable as a boolean.

[string] cvar
  Name of console variable

[boolean] default=false
  The value to return if the console variable does not exist

cvars.GetConVarCallbacks.description:
CVARS [Shared/Menu] Returns a table of the given ConVars callbacks.

[string] name
  The name of the ConVar.

[boolean] createIfNotFound=false
  Whether or not to create the internal callback table for given ConVar if there isn't one yet.

This argument is internal and should not be used.

cvars.Number.description:
CVARS [Shared/Menu] Retrieves console variable as a number.

[string] cvar
  Name of console variable

[any] default=nil
  The value to return if the console variable does not exist

cvars.OnConVarChanged.description:
CVARS [Shared/Menu] 

[string] name
  Convar name

[string] oldVal
  The old value of the convar

[string] newVal
  The new value of the convar

cvars.RemoveChangeCallback.description:
CVARS [Shared/Menu] 

[string] name
  The name of the convar to remove the callback from.

[string] indentifier
  The callback's identifier.

cvars.String.description:
CVARS [Shared/Menu] Retrieves console variable as a string.

[string] cvar
  Name of console variable

[any] default=nil
  The value to return if the console variable does not exist
